section.title: Demonstration 1 Main Page

content.text: The purpose of the Fixed Assets Journal is to provide an audit trail of all asset-related activity. It supplements the Transaction, Accounting, and General Journals by serving as a subsidiary ledger, and tracks asset-related transactions and asset-specific information that are not included in the other journals. In the demonstration, you can see what the query looks like and how to use it.

content.text: You can search for records based on the following selection criteria: Asset Type, Asset Number, Betterment Number, Asset Category, Asset Class, Asset Group, Custodial information, Location information, Acquisition Method, or by certain amounts. For example, Acquisitions costing more than $1,000,000.00.
And an Acquisition Cost of more than $1,000,000
Scroll down to see the results.
